Description:
Key AccountabilitiesDevelop Data Governance policies around: data lifecycle, data retention, model governance, regulatory reporting, business reporting, data documentation, data quality, metadata management, data classification.
Ensure Data Governance policies are addressed to responsible units: business, IT, Operations, Risk, Compliance.
Develop Data Governance metrics and monitor them.
Make sure Data Governance KPI’s are met within assigned domain.
Document Data Assets in Data Catalog, ensure Data Lineage is accurate.
Discover and document data in Source Systems. Assist Data Architects in developing Data Models.
Communicate with Source system owners, Project Management Office, Data Team and Business units to ensure documentation in Data Catalog is correct and up to date.Skills
Skills:
System or Business Analytics
Data Governance
Software and Tools knowledge
SQL – Advanced user (Stored Procedures, Window functions, Temp Tables)
Knowledge (at least one of) Data Catalog solution is a plus: IBM WKC, Ataccama, Infomatica Axon or EDC
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to details

Experience in Business and System Analysis
Understanding of main Banking Systems and technologies.
Experience in Data Governance or any Data related projects is a plus.
Understanding of the process of creating the reporting.
Experience in documenting requirements: BRD, FSD, testing plan etc.
BABoK certificate is a plus
DMBoK or DCAM certificate is a plus
Experience in Finance/Banking is a plus
Experience with data governance and data quality tools is a plus.

Adaptability/Flexibility
Creativity/Innovation
Decision Making/Judgment
Dependability
Initiative
Integrity/Ethics
Problem Solving/Analysis
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
